{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine the correct answer, we need to understand the definitions of the given terms. An epidemic refers to the occurrence of cases of a particular disease in a population that is greater than what is normally expected. Sporadic refers to the occurrence of cases of a disease in a random or isolated manner. Endemic refers to the constant presence and/or usual prevalence of a disease or infectious agent in a population within a geographic area. An outbreak refers to the occurrence of cases of a particular disease in a population that is greater than what is normally expected in a specific time and place.
